alert.note: Alert for Ford; Iroquois; Kankakee (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued May 07 at 9:06PM CDT until May 07 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: The National Weather Service in Chicago has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Southwestern Kankakee County in northeastern Illinois... Ford County in east central Illinois... Western Iroquois County in east central Illinois... * Until 1030 PM CDT. * At 905 PM CDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Morris to near Odell to near Chenoa to near Lexington, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Near zero visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Law enforcement and emergency management. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Including the following interstate... I-57 between mile markers 258 and 300. This wall of dust will be near... Piper City around 935 PM CDT. Gibson City, Gilman and Ashkum around 950 PM CDT. Onarga around 955 PM CDT. Paxton around 1005 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this wall of dust include Melvin, Union Hill, Thawville, Loda, Irwin, Sibley, Roberts, Clarence, Cabery and Stelle. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! There is no safe place on a highway when a dust storm hits. Visibility can be lost immediately, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel, or safely exit the highway before the dust storm arrives. Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
